Class Event

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.event.Event
Direct Known Subclasses:
Event_ContainerArrival, Event_ContainerValidation, Event_NewTransactionArrival, Event_Report_BeliefReport, Event_Report_NodeStatusReport, Event_Report_PeriodicReport, Event_Report_StructureReport, Event_SeedUpdate, Event_TransactionPropagation
public class Event extends Object
The Event object for the event-driven simulator
Author:
Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()

  • Method Details

    • getNextEventID

      public static long getNextEventID()
      Retrieves the next unique event ID.
      Returns:
      The next event ID.

    • setTime

      public void setTime(long time)
      Sets the time value of the event.
      Parameters:
      time - The time value to set (time greater than 0).
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if the provided time value is less than 0.

    • getTime

      public long getTime()
      Retrieves the time of the event.
      Returns:
      The simulation time of the event.

    • ignoreEvt

      public boolean ignoreEvt()
      Checks if the event should be ignored. Useful for when canceling future events.
      Returns:
      true if the event should be ignored, false otherwise.

    • ignoreEvt

      public void ignoreEvt(boolean ignoreEvt)
      Sets the ignore status of the event.
      Parameters:
      ignoreEvt - true to ignore the event, false otherwise.

    • getEvtID

      public long getEvtID()
      The ID of the current event object. IDs are created at the time of processing the event.
      Returns:
      The ID of the current event object

    • happen

      public void happen(Simulation sim)
      Executes the event in the simulation. Call node's periodic and time advancement reports.
      Parameters:
      sim - The simulation instance.

    • debugPrint

      public void debugPrint(String msg, Transaction tx, INode n, long tim, long delay)
      For debug purposes. Call this to print the even occurrence in the standard output. TODO: remove the parameters and make it specific on the event data.
      Parameters:
      msg - A message to be printed.
      tx - The relevant transaction.
      n - The relevant node.
      tim - The simulation time.
      delay - The time to delay before continuing.

    • debugPrint

      public void debugPrint(String msg, ITxContainer txc, INode n, long tim, long delay)
